thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 08 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Turkey's Unlu & Co plans M&A deals worth $2 billion in first half

author: Ebru Tuncay
title: Turkey's Unlu & Co plans M&A deals worth $2 billion in first half

organizations.name: reuters) - turkish financial services group unlu & co

text:
ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Turkish financial services group Unlu & Co plans to sign M&A consultancy deals worth around $2 billion in the first half, with one of the deals worth $1 billion, its chairman Mahmut Unlu told Reuters.
He said he expected initial public offerings in Turkey this year to amount to $3 billion, one of the highest ever levels.
“I think we will sign three or four M&A transactions in the first half of the year. One of them will have a volume of $1 billion,” Unlu said in an interview conducted on Wednesday.
The deals by Unlu & Co, which provides investment banking and asset management services, will be notably in infrastructure and consumption sectors, he added.
Reporting by Ebru Tuncay; Writing by Daren Butler; Editing by Ece Toksabay
Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.
